alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 5:30AM PST until December 16 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, with one to two feet in the High Sierra west of Highway 395. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph in wind prone locations along Highway 395 and up to 100 mph across Sierra Ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM PST Thursday. Peak snowfall rates from midnight through 8 am Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult across the Eastern Sierra. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute. Delays likely with road closures possible. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Expect periods of poor visibility in blowing snow.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
